isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - MASTER DIAGNOSTICS (MD 32) - TEXT WINDOW and ADDING PARAMETER IDENTIFIERS (PID)

svcproc.title: TEXT WINDOW and ADDING PARAMETER IDENTIFIERS (PID)

svcsubproc.title: Data in Text Format

step1.para: To monitor engine parameter data in text format create a text window.
Select File and then New on the menu bar to open the Select a File Type dialog box.
Select International Text View (.ntv) and click OK .

svcsubproc.para: A generic text view display window will appear without parameters. The Text view window has three columns: PID, Value, and Units. The PID column shows the PID description or acronym. The Value column shows the current data value. The Units column shows the display value units (English or metric).

step1.para: To add parameters to this window, select Edit and then Add/Delete/Edit Parameters on the menu bar.
Double click on a parameter or click on all of the desired parameters in the Available Parameter list box. Click the >>ADD>> button to add selected parameters to the Selected Parameter list box .

svcsubproc.para: The order of displayed PIDs in the text view window dependents on when a parameter is added to the Selected Parameter list. For example, if you double click Fuel Rate is double clicked first and Fueling Pulse Widthnext, Fuel Rate will be displayed on top of Fueling Pulse Width in the text view window. Use the vertical scroll bar to view additional parameters in the list box for Available Parameters.
Double click a parameter from the Selected Parameter list to remove it from the text view window .
To recall the original settings, click the Defaults button to restore the attributes to factory defaults.
When finished adding, deleting, and modifying attributes, click OK in the ADD/DELETE PARAMETERS dialog box.
The text window will show the selected parameters.
This text view window is configured and ready to use. Open the COM port to display data. The resulting window illustrates some parameter values (static data w/engine off) .
Click on Units, to display parameters be toggled between metric or English.
The information in these text view windows can be printed by selecting File and then Print on the menu bar .
Send the printout to the printer or to a file.

The configuration of these text windows can be saved. The list of displayed parameters, the font size, and type information are saved. The actual parameter data is not included as part of the configuration. Click on File then Save As.
The Save As file dialog box will appear .
Type a file name inside the File name edit box and click Save .
